meanings.definition: Unable to leave a place due to a storm.
meanings.sent1: The ship was stormbound in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The roads were stormbound, making travel impossible.
meanings.sent3: The stormbound sailors played cards to pass the time.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were stormbound, unable to break free.
meanings.sent5: The town was completely stormbound, isolated from the outside world.

meanings.definition: Restricted or confined by a storm.
meanings.sent1: The stormbound area was under evacuation orders.
meanings.sent2: The stormbound residents sought shelter in the basement.
meanings.sent3: The stormbound pets huddled together for warmth.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt stormbound, trapped in fear.
meanings.sent5: The stormbound forest was eerily quiet under the dark clouds.

meanings.definition: Delayed or hindered by a storm.
meanings.sent1: The stormbound flight finally took off after hours of waiting.
meanings.sent2: The stormbound construction project fell behind schedule.
meanings.sent3: The stormbound delivery truck got stuck in the mud.
meanings.sent4: His plans were stormbound, unable to progress.
meanings.sent5: The stormbound event had to be rescheduled due to the weather.
